description: Describe the previous term! (method B - initial term is 2).
links: Peter J. C. Moses, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..22
example: E.g. the term after 2113 is obtained by saying "2 once, 1 twice, 3 once", which gives 211231.
mathematica: a[0] = 2; a[n_] := a[n] = FromDigits[Flatten[{First[#], Length[#]} & /@ Split[IntegerDigits[a[n - 1]]]]]; Map[a,Range[0, 22]] (* _Peter J. C. Moses_, Mar 22 2013 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
